content: Write a script for a radio advertisement promoting a local music festival. The ad should mention the dates, location, lineup of bands, ticket prices, and special attractions of the festival.

[Upbeat background music starts playing softly in the background]

Announcer: "Hey there, music lovers! Are you ready to rock this weekend? Because something big is happening right here in town, and you won't want to miss it!"

[Music builds up slightly]

Announcer: "Introducing the annual GrooveFest Music Festival! Mark your calendars for this Saturday and Sunday, May 20th and 21st, right here in beautiful Central Park. That's right, two whole days of non-stop music, fun, and festivities!"

[Music swells with excitement]

Announcer: "Now, who's headlining this awesome event? Well, let me tell you, the lineup is absolutely stacked! On Saturday, we've got the legendary Rockin' Rebels, bringing their high-energy tunes to get you moving. Following them is the soulful voice of Blues Belter, known for getting everyone singing along. And to close out the night, the electrifying PowerPunks will have you dancing until dawn!"

[Music transitions to a rock beat]

Announcer: "Sunday promises more amazing acts. Starting off with the folk sensation, Acoustic Alice, who'll serenade you with her heartfelt ballads. Then, it's time for the funky beats of The GrooveMasters, guaranteed to get your feet tapping. And finally, wrapping up the festival, the chart-topping PopPrincess will treat you to her hit songs that you know and love!"

[Music shifts to a pop tune]

Announcer: "But that's not all! GrooveFest isn't just about music. We've got a fantastic food court with vendors from all over the city, offering everything from gourmet burgers to exotic desserts. Plus, there's a vibrant art market where you can pick up unique souvenirs and support local artists."

[Music adds a festive flair]

Announcer: "And for the little ones, we've set up a kid's zone with face painting, balloon artists, and fun games. There's something for everyone at GrooveFest!"

[Music becomes more upbeat]

Announcer: "Now, about tickets. Adult tickets are just $40 for a single day or grab a weekend pass for $70, saving you $10. For kids under 12, it's only $20 a day or $35 for both days. And remember, tickets bought in advance online are cheaper than at the gate."

[Music hints at a deal]

Announcer: "But hurry, because early bird tickets are going fast! Visit our website at GrooveFest.com to snap up your tickets now."

[Music builds up again]

Announcer: "Oh, and here's a special attraction this year. We're hosting a Guitar Hero competition on Saturday night. If you think you've got what it takes, sign up at the festival and show off your skills. The winner gets a brand-new electric guitar and a spot on next year's lineup!"

[Music becomes more competitive and exciting]

Announcer: "So, mark your calendars, gather your friends and family, and get ready for an unforgettable weekend of music, food, and fun at GrooveFest. See you there!"

[Music ends on a high note]

Announcer: "GrooveFest, May 20th and 21st, Central Park. Tickets at GrooveFest.com."

[Music fades out]
